goal.ch: The primary goal of PH3009 is to prepare physics students for advanced physics courses and basic trainings in their future research areas, such as atomic, molecular, and optical (AMO) physics, condensed matter physics, high energy physics, and nonlinear physics.
goal.en: The primary goal of PH3009 is to prepare physics students for advanced physics courses and basic trainings in their future research areas, such as atomic, molecular, and optical (AMO) physics, condensed matter physics, high energy physics, and nonlinear physics.

outline.ch: This one-semester core course introduces students to quantum mechanics (QM) through the following topics: (1) the emergence of quantum physics, (2) wave-particle duality and the Bohr model, (3) the Schrödinger equation, (4) eigenvalues and eigenstates of the Schrödinger equation in one dimension (1D), (5) general structure of wave mechanics, (6) operator methods in QM, (7) angular momentum, (8) the Schrödinger equation in 3D, (9) matrix representation for operators, (10) electron spin, and (11) non-interacting many-electron systems. In PH3009, structure and application(s) of QM are emphasized. While the historical development and philosophical implications of QM are briefly discussed, these topics are not the main focus of this course.
